answers.answer: I didn't think boy/girl twins could be identical!Congrats none the less, though! lol I'll bet you were in total shock, huh?

oh boy i hope you dont have too many problems with preeclampsia. wow twin girls (maybe huh? LOL) how exciting!! i always wonder how parents can keep track of who is who lol. good luck with the rest of your pregnancy.
Hey thats awesome. Identical twins... It's going to be fun. Great news your previa moved too. When did you get your first sexing u/s? what wk were you? just curious.
I guess I need to learn to read and THEN talk on the phone. I lost my ability to multi task! lol Anyhow...I read too fast and thought you said your girl was a boy and not vice versa! lol :)
Wow!   Thats crazy!   I'm having a boy and have all boy stuff.  I think I would laugh if "he" came out a girl!!   Congrats, identical twins will be a blast!
That is great!  I would love to have identical twins!  Congratulations!
hah, i wonder, my poor SO is feeling overwhelmed by estrogen already and has threatened to keep a sharpie in his pocket so he can mark the bottom of one of their feet!men!

my dh was telling me about someone he knew or something they had twins or triplets. they had a tattoo placed on their toes, like dots!! oh my!! i suppose one gets pink socks and the other purple lol. im sure their little personalities will show very quickly and you will get who is who. it would be easy if one has a freckle on a certain spot the other didnt!

first time was 17 weeks we even saw the little turtle in it's shell that indicates boy on baby b and the three lines for a girl on baby a. i have the pics!!!! then next week baby a showed it all but baby b was shy and so on, then today after much prodding she opened her legs and there it was, no turtle. they explained it as swollen labia.  just to be sure they kept going back and forth today double checking and made darn sure they saw both of them.we had 6 ultrasounds since 17 weeks and at two baby b looked like a boy, two the legs were crossed then today it was so clear. amazing. i have a friend having a boy so at least i can put my boy stuff to good use. lol
I already call my kids by the wrong names, sometimes they even get the dogs name....I can't imagine if I had identical twins.Congrats, sister.

oh my what a surprise!! we had my u/s at 16 weeks and it was definatly girl, three lines and no sign of a turtle, but my dh is still holding out for delivery to be sure, i thought it would be impossible, but i guess you never know!

Identical twins!!!!!   How exciting!anxiousmomtobe:  I thought I was the only one in the world to mix up the kids and dogs names.Last week I called my 7 yr old son "Lizzie"  (she's our golden retriever)  He looked at me and said "Are you ok?  Why would you think I'm the dog?"

Identical twins!!  How exciting!!!  I always look forward to reading your updates, so keep em' coming!!! :)Not to end this on a bummer of a note, but I posted an update on me last Saturday.  I had emergency surgery on Friday for a tubal (ectopic) in my left tube.  They ended up taking my left tube out.  When I got to my room the dr came in and seen me and said that it also showed evidence of a previous ectopic so apparently that's what my problem was back in Oct./Nov.  He said hopefully by removing the tube it should clear up my problem.
It's really bad when ds is 3.5 and dd is 16, they get very offended when I mix them up.Poor dog is totally confused, he can't figure out who I am yelling at.Placenta brain....

don't feel bad, i have called my SO by the fish names. that's what he gets for giving them names and talking about them.thanks everyone, we are really excited whether it be girls boys or monkeys. just the fact that the previa went away and their healthy is amazing...perty....tattoos huh? hope their dear old daddy doesn't get any bright ideas.since we have had somewhere in the ballpark of 10 ultrasounds so far do you guys think it's weird to start a picture album with all the little pictures? i was just looking at them from 5 weeks to now. so much changes so fast. i got in the habit of calling them beans, but after seeing their eyes and noses and all, even them kicking each other and we got a picture of baby b punching baby a in the back of the head(!) i think an album is in order.imagine the she hit me first arguements, i can whip out my trusty album and say"no, you clearly hit her first" :P
Monkeys???   Hahahahaha    That made me almost spit out my pop.

oh gosh, i'm so sorry, i must have skipped your post somehow. i'm glad you at least know what happened, but it stinks :( i'm sure you have a big fat extra fertile tube on the other side just loaded with all the right stuff and ready to carry that egg to your uterus.please don't get to down on yourself, i just know you are gonna have a healthy one soon.***hugs***
Wow how exciting congrats to you!

I really hope you're right!  I keep hoping that in my head over and over again....time will tell!!!  I should O in about 2 weeks exactly so...maybe it will be the luck of the draw.  Last time it took us 3 months to conceive!

how does it change with one tube? i read somewhere that you release the egg from alternating tubes each month. i'm not sure that was accurate, but is there a test you can do or do you just bd away? (bet dh isn't complaining!)

question: well, i keep seeing people posting about genders and so on. let me tell you gys about my day!i had a regular ob appointment this morning. my urine had sugar in it. ugh...my feet were swollen so i may be developing preeclampsia and i have gained 12 pounds at 23 weeks with twins. all in all i'll survive. my groin is pulled and i get to ice it.(owwies) and that's no big deal. now for the interesting partif you all remember i posted the gender of my babies about a month ago. well...today the ultrasound girl thought baby b(my boy) was a girl. but she was not sure.we left there and went to the perinatologist where we ended up having a second ultrasound. they have perfect anatomies and my son has turned into my daughter. clearly there is no outtie there! and they are probably identical. holy ****!so girls, i suggest that you not put too much stock in early gender verifications. even boys can turn out to be girls. loloh yeah and my placenta previa is completely gone and 3.4 cm away from the cervix where it was partially covering the opening 10 weeks ago :)yayayay. there is hope
title: just when you think you know
